definition: sold out/to be out of stock
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
official records/grade (of goods)/file/records/shelves/slot/gap/crosspiece/classifier for crosspieces/classifier for events, affairs etc/Taiwan pr. [dang3]

sentences.english: the problem is that there's a discontinuity in the wage spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 問題在於這種薪酬是有斷檔的。

sentences.english: So, going back to enterprise architecture, there is a fundamental disconnect.
sentences.chinese: 那麼回到企業架構，其中有一個根本的斷檔。

sentences.english: In nearly every startup that fails, the proximate cause is running out of money.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每場失敗的創業都是直接因爲資金斷檔造成的。

sentences.english: This has become a purely non-entertainment gap.
sentences.chinese: 這種純屬民間的娛樂活動成了斷檔。
